snippet: The Fashion in Film Festival’s third series is a showcase of lavish and fantastical eye candy, presenting the work of costume design greats like Adrian and Edith Head....
lead_paragraph: Kicking off this weekend at the Museum of the Moving Image in Astoria, Queens, the Fashion in Film Festival will be showing its third series of quality films, “Birds of Paradise.” Focusing primarily on the role of the costume, the festival aims to serve as a visual history lesson for fashion and film buffs with a timeline of European and American cinematic gems. Films scheduled to screen include the rare (Nino Oxilia’s “Rapsodia Satanica,” Jack Smith’s “Normal Love”) and the already loved (Cecil B. DeMille’s “Male and Female”).
abstract: The Fashion in Film Festival’s third series is a showcase of lavish and fantastical eye candy, presenting the work of costume design greats like Adrian and Edith Head.

headline.main: A Fest for the Eyes

snippet: Fashion may not be art, but art is certainly in fashion this spring. Dresses, shirts, ties and tights are flaunting patterns inspired by Pop Art, Op Art and Abstract Expressionism. There are even hints of Matisse.   Historically, the influence of ...
lead_paragraph: Fashion may not be art, but art is certainly in fashion this spring. Dresses, shirts, ties and tights are flaunting patterns inspired by Pop Art, Op Art and Abstract Expressionism. There are even hints of Matisse. Historically, the influence of artists on fashion designers can be traced to shortly after World War I, when Paul Poiret used Raoul Dufy's vibrantly colored and patterned fabrics in the Fauve style.

headline.main: A Season for Wearing Your Art on Your Sleeve

snippet: The images in “Francesca Woodman,” a career retrospective of the photographer who took her own life at 22, project a self surrendering unreservedly to the spirit of art....
lead_paragraph: The images in “Francesca Woodman,” a career retrospective of the photographer who took her own life at 22, project a self surrendering unreservedly to the spirit of art.
abstract: Ken Johnson reviews photographs by Francesca Woodman at the Guggenheim Museum.

headline.seo: ‘Francesca Woodman’ at Guggenheim Museum
headline.main: Exposing the Body, Baring the Soul
headline.print_headline: Exposing the Body, Baring the Soul

snippet: A number of tech-savvy guys starting their own clothing labels see themselves as entrepreneurs, not designers....
lead_paragraph: A number of tech-savvy guys starting their own clothing labels see themselves as entrepreneurs, not designers.
abstract: Peter Semple, who started clothing label Golden Axe London with his brother Richard Semple, is part of a new breed of male clothing designers, tech-savvy entrepreneurs with passion for fashion; idea behind their designs is to create comfortable clothing that looks nice and fits well.

headline.seo: New Wave of Male Entrepreneurs Changing Fashion Scene
headline.main: But Can They Write Fashion Code?
headline.print_headline: But Can They Write Fashion Code?

snippet: Sales are slumping at American clothing brands like Gap as foreign fast-fashion upstarts like H&M, Uniqlo and Zara lure away customers....
lead_paragraph: Sales are slumping at American clothing brands like Gap as foreign fast-fashion upstarts like H&M, Uniqlo and Zara lure away customers.
abstract: Gap, once an icon of midmarket American fashion, is struggling with slumping sales amid incursion by foreign upstarts like H&M, Uniqlo and Zara; company has announced it will close one quarter of its North American stores; beyond foreign competitors, retailer also faces splintered customer base that has gravitated either toward luxury market or discount retailers who are both reporting surging profits.

headline.main: Gap’s Fashion-Backward Moment
